sources.title: Woman Hater
sources.description: Title: Woman Hater Summary: Lord Terence Datchett is a "confirmed bachelor" who doesn't really have much use for women. He meets up with a French movie star, Colette Marly, and takes a dislike to her, especially when ... Directed by: Terence Young Actors: Stewart Granger, Edwige Feuillère, Ronald Squire Production Company: Two Cities Films Release Date: 15 November 1948 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Lord Terence Datchett is a "confirmed bachelor" who doesn't really have much use for women. He meets up with a French movie star, Colette Marly, and takes a dislike to her, especially when it seems that she is deliberately trying to ruin his evening. He reads that the fetching Miss Marly is "bored" with men and, suspecting that it is a publicity stunt on her part, pretends to be a real-estate agent trying to sell her his country estate, all the while planning to "expose" her. Complications ensue.

metadata.Plot: Lord Terence Datchett is a "confirmed bachelor" who doesn't really have much use for women. He meets up with a French movie star, Colette Marly, and takes a dislike to her, especially when it seems that she is deliberately trying to ruin his evening. He reads that the fetching Miss Marly is "bored" with men and, suspecting that it is a publicity stunt on her part, pretends to be a real-estate agent trying to sell her his country estate, all the while planning to "expose" her. Complications ensue.
metadata.Writer: Robert Westerby, Nicholas Phipps, Alec Coppel
metadata.Actors: Stewart Granger, Edwige Feuillère, Ronald Squire
